snippet: The Vostok Battalion’s composition has raised questions about Russia’s role in eastern Ukraine. Its resolve could determine how long the fighting continues.
abstract: Threat of a Russian invasion into eastern Ukraine has declined and appeals for annexation by rebel politicians have gone unanswered, but pace of fighting has picked up in eastern Ukraine with both the Kiev government and the separatists trying to seize momentum; Vostok Battalion, largest separatist militia group in Donetsk, has set up training camp and considers itself autonomous.
lead_paragraph: The Vostok Battalion’s composition has raised questions about Russia’s role in eastern Ukraine. Its resolve could determine how long the fighting continues.

headline.main: A Separatist Militia in Ukraine With Russian Fighters Holds a Key
headline.print_headline: A Separatist Militia in Ukraine With Russian Fighters Holds a Key
